briefdescription.para: High level function interface for performing AES encryption on FILE pointers Uses OpenSSL libcrypto EVP API .

detaileddescription.para:
By Andy Sayler (www.andysayler.com) Created 04/17/12
Modified 18/10/23 by [Carlo Alberto Giordano]
Derived from OpenSSL.org EVP_Encrypt_* Manpage Examples http://www.openssl.org/docs/crypto/EVP_EncryptInit.html#EXAMPLES With additional information from Saju Pillai's OpenSSL AES Example http://saju.net.in/blog/?p=36 http://saju.net.in/code/misc/openssl_aes.c.txt
FILE
*in The input file
FILE
*out The output file
int
action Defines if the action to do on the input file should be of encryption or decryption.
ENCRYPT
DECRYPT
unsigned
char *key_str The key that must be AES 256
1 if successful, 0 otherwise. An error might be printen by print_err() function,
print_err
This function cyphers using AES 256 CBC

internal.para:
This function is marked as internal and should not be used by the user
param
return
